channel.title: MIDIµ/in/key - connected to strange MIDI device
channel.description: Hello I digged out a strange MIDIController: with two foor pedals. I tested it in pd with a midi sport - and it gave the values in omni: 48 127 4 and 48 127 3. When I attach the device to Axoloti, and I use the mide/key/in object and connect some disp/i, it doesn't give any value. What is happening? Is there another objects wich is better, to test the correct midi key value? I want tor trigger something. xm

item.title: MIDIµ/in/key - connected to strange MIDI device
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

according to the manual, this is note 48 on (vel 127)channel 4... (and 3)

can you get a raw midi dump , Id like to see the full midi stream (raw bytes).
Id use a proper midi logger rather than PD, but I assume its possible in PD, as I sometimes do this in max (Max its midi in -> capture)

Read full topic
item.source: MIDIµ/in/key - connected to strange MIDI device

item.source: MIDIµ/in/key - connected to strange MIDI device

item.title: MIDIµ/in/key - connected to strange MIDI device
item.dc:creator: @johannes johannes
item.description:
@johannes wrote:

ooooo:

a strange MIDIController

oooooh, I recognize that, it is an early MidiBox clone...

ooooo:

and it gave the values in omni: 48 127 4 and 48 127 3.

can't make sense of these number, what object in pd did you use? If it is midi note on/off, use "midi/in/keyb" and select the "right" channel in the patch settings. If it is a midi continuous controller, check with "midi/in/cc i any", connect the outlets to "disp/i" objects.

Read full topic
item.source: MIDIµ/in/key - connected to strange MIDI device

item.title: MIDIµ/in/key - connected to strange MIDI device

item.description:
@ooooo wrote:

Hello I digged out a strange MIDIController:
with two foor pedals.

I tested it in pd with a midi sport - and it gave the values in omni: 48 127 4 and 48 127 3.

When I attach the device to Axoloti, and I use the mide/key/in object and connect some disp/i, it doesn't give any value. What is happening? Is there another objects wich is better, to test the correct midi key value? I want tor trigger something.

xm
